      • isAutoResize

        public boolean isAutoResize()

      • setAutoResize

        public void setAutoResize(boolean autoResize)
        Enables or disables auto-resize functionality. By default, auto-resize functionality is off. When auto-resize is on, createDisplay() will add the AllegroLibrary.ALLEGRO_RESIZABLE flag to the calling thread before creating the display, and in the event loop will automatically call AllegroLibrary.al_acknowledge_resize(ALLEGRO_DISPLAY) on resize events. To handle this properly, a game can call getDisplayWidth() and getDisplayHeight() on each update/render to find out the current game window size.

      • createDisplay

      • onEvent

        protected boolean onEvent(org.gillius.jalleg.binding.ALLEGRO_EVENT event)
        Method called when any event is processed, including the events generated by the game loop mainTimer and ALLEGRO_EVENT_DISPLAY_CLOSE generated by the display window. If true is returned, the game loop will process the event, else the game loop will ignore the event and not process it in the standard way.

      • onUnhandledEvent

        protected void onUnhandledEvent(org.gillius.jalleg.binding.ALLEGRO_EVENT event)
        Called on any event type not handled by the built-in event handling (such as for mainTimer events and ALLEGRO_EVENT_DISPLAY_CLOSE).

      • isMouseButtonDown

        protected boolean isMouseButtonDown(int button)
        If the mouse addon is installed, return if the designated mouse button is pressed.
        Parameters:
        button - 0 for primary button, 1 for secondary button, 2 for middle, etc.

      • isJoyDirection

        protected boolean isJoyDirection(Direction direction)
        If the joystick addon is installed and at least one joystick was plugged in, returns true if the joystick being pressed in the given direction. This method is used for simple "d-pad" like functionality. Always returns false if joystick addon is not installed or no joystick is connected.
        See Also:
        joy1
